content.rendered:
Good Morning SSHS Students!

Happy Monday and Week 7 of remote learning! We hope you have a wonderful week and that your remote learning is progressing in a positive way! We’ve been talking about a great many things: grading for Quarter 4, remote learning instruction, awards ceremonies that have been paused, and graduation back-up plans. We are supposed to be hearing about if school will reopen after May 15 this week from Governor Cuomo. Rest assured that we will be providing you with updates about our discussions depending on when we might return to school. Stay tuned to your emails!

Keep up the great work that you are doing in your learning! We know that this “new normal” has been a strange adjustment, and that everyone is missing seeing their teachers and friends after being away from school for 7 weeks. Remember that we are here to support you, and that we miss seeing you everyday!

To start off your week, please see this special message from Special Education teacher, Mrs. Hauenstein!

Have a wonderful week, we hope you’re all well, and stay healthy!

Sincerely,

HS Administrative Team
